project.description:
This job demonstrates basic usage of the various Parameter Types provided by Cloudify's Jenkins plugin.
* Note: for the "Cloudify Constrained Input Value Selector" to work, a blueprint must exist on Cloudify Manager with an input that has a constrained value. This example in this job is based on Cloudify's official examples; the "app-nodejs" blueprint can be located here: https://github.com/cloudify-community/blueprint-examples/blob/master/getting-started/mc-nodejs.yaml

co.cloudify.jenkins.plugin.parameters.Bl.name: blueprint_id
co.cloudify.jenkins.plugin.parameters.Bl.description: This dropdown should show all blueprints uploaded to Cloudify Manager. The selected value will be available as a variable called "blueprint_id".

co.cloudify.jenkins.plugin.parameters.Bl.name: input_value
co.cloudify.jenkins.plugin.parameters.Bl.description: This dropdown should show all possible values for an input. The selected value will be available as a variable called "input_value".

co.cloudify.jenkins.plugin.parameters.De.name: deployment_id
co.cloudify.jenkins.plugin.parameters.De.description: This dropdown should show all deployments on Cloudify Manager.

co.cloudify.jenkins.plugin.parameters.Te.name: tenant_id
co.cloudify.jenkins.plugin.parameters.Te.description: This dropdown should show all tenants on Cloudify Manager.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command: echo "Blueprint ID: ${blueprint_id}" echo "Input value: ${input_value}" echo "Deployment ID: ${deployment_id}" echo "Tenant ID: ${tenant_id}"
